Comment: Most masters open with this move in simuls. It usually leads to a quicker win.
Electing to play a French defense, hoping to draw out his resistance.
The logical response, to avoid doubled Pawns and win back Black's advanced pawn.
Black counters with a threat to Dake's QP.
Black has a brilliant counter in mind, which Dake overlooks.
Following through with his plan. However, QxP(K4) was a *much* better alternative.
With mate to follow at once.
Bravo! Score one for the amateur!
